reasoning: Factor V deficiency is a rare inherited bleeding disorder (autosomal recessive). Incidence estimated at 0.8 per 100k births; prevalence approximately 1 per 100k population. Accounts for <1% of inherited coagulation disorders. Heterogeneous penetrance and severity.
source: Castaman G et al. (2005). Factor V, fibrinogen, and platelets in plasma: epidemiology and resistance to activated protein C. J Thromb Haemost. 3(11):2456-2461
